name: Flow

node.title: Flow.id
node.description: A unique identifier for the flow

node.title: Reference.type
node.description:
The name of the referenced validation type
This will be used to lookup the proper handler

node.title: Reference.message
node.description: An optional means of overriding the default message if the validation is triggered

node.name: Severity
node.title: Reference.severity
node.description: An optional means of overriding the default severity of the validation if triggered

node.name: Trigger
node.title: Reference.trigger
node.description: When to run this particular validation

node.title: CrossfieldReference.dataTarget
node.description: Cross-field references and validation must run against the default (deformatted) value

node.name: DisplayTarget
node.title: Reference.displayTarget
node.description: Where the error should be displayed

node.title: CrossfieldReference.ref
node.description: The binding to associate this validation with

node.title: validation
node.description: Each view can optionally supply a list of validations to run against a particular view

node.title: Flow.views
node.description: A list of views (each with an ID) that can be shown to a user

node.name: Schema
Node

additionalProperties.name: DataType

node.title: DataType.type
node.description: The reference of the base type to use

node.title: DataType.isArray
node.description: The referenced object represents an array rather than an object

elementType.name: Reference

node.title: Reference.type
node.description:
The name of the referenced validation type
This will be used to lookup the proper handler

node.title: Reference.message
node.description: An optional means of overriding the default message if the validation is triggered

node.name: Severity
node.title: Reference.severity
node.description: An optional means of overriding the default severity of the validation if triggered

node.name: Trigger
node.title: Reference.trigger
node.description: When to run this particular validation

node.title: Reference.dataTarget
node.description:
Each validation is passed the value of the data to run it's validation against.
By default, this is the value stored in the data-model (deformatted).
In the off chance you'd like this validator to run against the formatted value (the one the user sees), set this option

node.name: DisplayTarget
node.title: Reference.displayTarget
node.description: Where the error should be displayed

elementType.title: Reference
elementType.description: A reference to a validation object

node.title: DataType.validation
node.description:
Any additional validations that are associated with this property
These will add to any base validations associated with the "type"

node.name: Reference

node.title: Reference.type
node.description: The name of the formatter (and de-formatter) to use

node.title: DataType.format
node.description:
A reference to a specific data format to use.
If none is specified, will fallback to that of the base type

node.title: DataType.default
node.description:
A default value for this property.
Any reads for this property will result in this default value being written to the model.

additionalProperties.title: DataType
additionalProperties.description: Each prop in the object can have a specific DataType

node.title: Schema.ROOT
node.description: The ROOT object is the top level object to use

or.title: NavigationFlowExternalState
or.description:
External Flow states represent states in the FSM that can't be resolved internally in Player.
The flow will wait for the embedded application to manage moving to the next state via a transition
